newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani rupee ends steady, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani rupee ends steady, seen stable.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee ended steady at 41.32 to the dollar in the kerb market on Saturday amid a slightly lower demand for the U.S. currency, dealers said.

The rupee has been stable for about six weeks, moving in a narrow band on lack of speculative interest. "Speculators are busy in stocks after the recent surge in the Karachi index and easing of fears about rupee devaluation," one dealer said. The central bank rate was unchanged at 40.5200/40.7226. The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates ended unchanged at 2.0 percent. -- Amir Zia (9221) 5685192; Fax 5673428
